article.title: Fully Kinetic Simulation of 3D Kinetic Alfven Turbulence

multiple_choice_question.text: What quantities are plotted in Figure 1 as a function of time (normalized to the box-scale Alfven transit time)?
choices: Mean fluctuating magnetic energy and mean-square electric current.
Mean kinetic energy and mean-square magnetic field.
Mean thermal pressure and mean-square electric field.
Mean fluid velocity and mean-square density.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the one-dimensional spectra in Figure 2 reveal about the sub-ion-scale fluctuations?
choices: They are dominated by particle noise.
They show a clear power-law scaling across all scales.
They are consistent with theoretical expectations for whistler waves.
They are consistent with theoretical expectations for kinetic Alfvén waves.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the ratios of the k⟂ spectra shown in Figure 3 demonstrate?
choices: The simulation results contradict the linear kinetic Alfvén wave theory.
The simulation results match theoretical expectations for kinetic Alfvén waves.
The sub-ion-scale fluctuations are better described by whistler waves.
The simulation suffers from strong numerical heating effects.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the results presented in Figure 4 suggest about the nature of the kinetic cascade?
choices: It is suppressed by strong collisional damping.
It is dominated by whistler wave turbulence.
It is close to a state of critical balance.
It is heavily influenced by the reduced ion-electron mass ratio used in the simulation.
